popt4jlib.MSSC1D

Class Solver

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.MSSC1D.Solver

  • public class Solver
extends java.lang.Object
    Solver class implements methods based on Dynamic Programming to solve the problem of clustering a sequence of numbers among k clusters. Both serial and parallel versions are provided. The solveXXXMat() methods are the fastest as they are based on the native matrix represenations of clusters instead of using Cluster and ClusterSet objects.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Solver(Params p)
      sole public constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getIncumbentValue() 
      int getNumIters() 
      java.util.Vector getSolutionIndices() 
      ClusterSet getSolutionSortedIndices() 
      ClusterSet getSolutionWOrigIndices() 
      double solveDP()
      solve the 1-D clustering problem (using Cluster and ClusterSet objects).
      double solveDP2()
      this method is the same as solveDP() except the (i,k) loop runs vertically instead of horizontally so that memory is saved Thus the outer loop is k, the inner loop is i
      double solveDP2Parallel(int numthreads)
      this method is the same as solveDP2() except we use numthreads threads to run the inner vertical loop for the i=n-2...0 computing the k-th column values
      double solveDP2ParallelMat(int numthreads)
      this method is the same as solveDP2Parallel() using numthreads threads to run the inner vertical loop for the i=n-2...0 computing the k-th column values It also doesnt' use ClusterSets, and so it's much faster.
      double solveDPMat()
      this method is the same as solveDP() except it doesn't use ClusterSets.

      • solveDP

        public double solveDP()
               throws CException
        solve the 1-D clustering problem (using Cluster and ClusterSet objects).
        Returns:
        double the value of the clustering i.e. the MSSC value of the optimal asgnmnt of numbers in the sequence to be clustered to clusters.
        Throws:
        CException
